description: Dhikr is the act of remembering and mentioning Allah through words of praise, gratitude, glorification, or seeking forgiveness. It can be done silently or aloud, alone or in gatherings, and is a constant means of keeping the heart connected to Allah.

importance.text: Verily, in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find rest.
So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.

types_of_dhikr: Tahmeed (Alhamdulillah – All praise is for Allah)
Takbeer (Allahu Akbar – Allah is the Greatest)
Tahleel (La ilaha illa Allah – None has the right to be worshipped except Allah)
Istighfar (Astaghfirullah – I seek forgiveness from Allah)
Salawat (Sending peace upon Prophet Muhammad ﷺ)
Daily Adhkar (morning, evening, after prayer, before sleep)
etiquettes_of_dhikr: Understand the meaning of what you say
Sit in a clean and calm place if possible
times_when_dhikr_is_highly_encouraged: Morning (after Fajr) and evening (after Asr or Maghrib)
While fasting or doing good deeds

hadiths.text: Shall I not tell you of the best of your deeds, the purest of them with your Master, and the highest of them in your ranks...? It is the remembrance of Allah.
Keep your tongue moist with the remembrance of Allah.
The one who remembers Allah and the one who does not are like the living and the dead.

benefits: Brings peace and tranquility to the heart
Earns continuous reward even with little effort
Increases faith and love for Allah
Reminds us of the hereafter and keeps us humble
